pullRequest.title: Implement SDL-0148 Additional SubMenus
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes #716
This PR is ready for review.
Risk
This PR makes minor API changes.
Testing Plan

 I have verified that I have not introduced new warnings in this PR (or explain why below)
 I have run the unit tests with this PR
 I have tested this PR against Core and verified behavior (if applicable, if not applicable, explain why below).
 I have tested Android, Java SE

Unit Tests
Unit test added to AddSubMenuTest.java
Core Tests
Core branch: smartdevicelink/sdl_core#3447
Rpc_Spec branch: smartdevicelink/rpc_spec#263
Generic_HMI branch: smartdevicelink/generic_hmi#282
Summary
This PR implements  SDL-0148 Template Improvements: Additional Submenus.
When testing create an integration branch with PR SDL-0152 Driver Distraction: Command List Limitations and test together. You can easily implement submenu feature by modifying BaseMenuManger.subMenuCommandForMenuCell by putting the code below before the return statement to test.
if(cell.getParentCellId() != MAX_ID) {
	subMenu.setParentID(cell.getParentCellId());
}
``


### Tasks Remaining:
- [x] Compare with IOS
- [x] Test aginst core
- [x] Test with JavaSE

### CLA
- [x] I have signed [the CLA](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdsgJY33VByaX482zHzi-xUm49JNnmuJOyAM6uegPQ2LXYVfA/viewform)

nodes.bodyText: Can we also add min & max values to the javadoc?
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -98,6 +98,13 @@ * * SmartDeviceLink 6.0 * + * + * parentID + * Integer + * unique ID of the sub menu, the command will be added to. If not provided or 0, it will beprovided to the top level of the in application menu. + * N + * SmartDeviceLink 7.0.0 + *

commit.message: Update JavaDocs to add min and max value
